Events that occurred on 13 December.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1907 - Translator Ebba-Margareta von Freymann is born.
1937 - Arthur Ransome writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien.
1954 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Rayner Heppenstall.
1957 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 204a.
1967 - Margaret Carroux comes to meet J.R.R. Tolkien in Oxford to talk about her German translation.
1972 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 346.
2012 - The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey is released in Europe.
2013 - The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug is released.
2013 - The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug: Chronicles: Art & Design is published.
2015 - Author Daniel Grotta dies.
2024 - The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim is scheduled to be released in cinemas.[1]

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ Anthony D'Alessandro, "‘Lord Of The Rings: The War Of The Rohirrim’ Release Delayed Until December 2024" dated 24 August 2022, (accessed 11 April 2024)
